review.reviewText: within walking distance of old town and the "new" Roman bridge!  Very helpful staff.
The room was clean, central location, and the staff was friendly! Very nice experience.

I had 2 days in Ronda.  The hotel was on a side street but very near to the central part of the town.  The room was clean and comfortable and the staff were very helpful.  I would definitely recommend it as good value for money.

review.title: A lovely, comfortable stay.
review.reviewText: A perfect place to stay in Ronda, comfortable, lovely staff, nice breakfast, close to everything.  We would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Size of room, big closet.   Nice clean bathroom.   Shuttered windows.   Close to everything.   Excellent breakfast.   Friendly and helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Just a small thing:  the shelf in the bathroom was tilted.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to everything in old Ronda !   Steps down to the water, fabulous views, wonderful restaurants

review.title: Excellent,  low cost, good value, well located.
review.reviewText: Great simple stop over in Ronda for a fly a way wedding plus sight seeing. One night. Room, breakfast and staff most satisfactory.

review.title: A good hotel for a quick visit to Ronda
review.reviewText:
Quite close to the centre of Ronda: just 5 minutes walk from the New Bridge. I was able to find street parking about 250 metres away. Tricky to find the place initially among the maze of streets.

Good, clean, comfortable room. Helpful, friendly and efficient staff.

I didn't have breakfast here, as the breakfast area was very busy and there are lots of other places in Ronda to choose from.
review.locationRemarks: Conveniently placed for exploring the centre of Ronda

review.title: Great location in Ronda
review.reviewText: Hotel San Francisco was located one block from the main pedestrian street in Ronda. It was close to shops, dining and tourist attractions. It's also an easy walk from the train and bus stations. Ronda is an amazing Andalusian Hill County Town and we're glad we stayed there rather than Sevilla or one of the other smaller towns. The hotel itself is comfortable and the staff was pleasant.
review.negativeRemarks: First floor room was loud in the mornings
review.locationRemarks: Close to major attractions, dining, shopping, etc. in Ronda

review.title: really cozy hotel
review.reviewText: Really old but really nice hotel, not sure if it was not a bit over priced for 2 stars and such a small city but we had a good time
review.locationRemarks: city is so small so everything is in a walking distance

review.title: Good car parking.
review.reviewText: Good hotel, well placed for new and old town. Reception was very helpful with car parking. Hotel has an arrangement with a modern, cool, underground car park nearby to park at a preferential rate (8e).

review.title: Will stay again.
review.reviewText: Hotel located next to shopping street n 5 mins away from town. Recommend staying here. Breakfast not included. I will eat out.
review.negativeRemarks: No wifi in room. Only in lObby.

review.title: Seasoned Travelers Very Dissatisfied
review.reviewText: A ** star hotel that should be rated only a one * hotel. Location of hotel was difficult to find and parking was limited to street parking. The breakfast that was offered was toast, coffee, tea and juice for $3.50. Older hotel in an older neighborhood. They have a policy of not changing the towels except every other day. Entrance/Exit to hotel was difficult with small entry to lobby. One of our fellow travelers slipped coming out the door and fell on the sidewalk, twisting her knee. No one from the hotel came to see how she was doing.
review.positiveRemarks: Within walking distance of the Old Town area.
review.negativeRemarks: Linen policy, breakfast options and general overall condition of hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Very hard to find. Had to stop for directions.

review.title: Good basic accommodation
review.reviewText: Excellent value for money, with very helpful staff.
review.locationRemarks: Good location, with free parking outside the hotel if you are lucky enough to find a spot.

review.title: Great location, atmosphere and value
review.reviewText: We spent 3 nights in Hotel San Francisco and would absolutely recommend it! It's just a block off the main pedestrian street, so the location is convenient but it's still quiet in the rooms. The attached cafe had a good, reasonably priced breakfast. Staff was friendly & helpful and all staff members appeared to speak at least some English. The room decorations are charming; overall great value!
review.locationRemarks: I'd recommend the area around Calle Espinea -- the main pedestrian street through Ronda -- in the new side of town. The street offers the most shopping and concentration of restaurants. Only a short walk to the bridge, the bull ring, or into the more historical side of Ronda.

review.title: Great place to stay in Ronda
review.reviewText: Five of us stayed two nights in 3 rooms and found it affordable, clean and centrally located. Good quiet air conditioning. Parking is about a 10 minute walk away in an underground lot for 8 Euro (regular price about 17). Very helpful staff.

review.title: Hotel San Francisco, Ronda, Spain
review.reviewText: No TV remotes in the room - had to ask at front desk & they did not have any. TV in room was not working - could not switch me to another room or take a remote from another room. Front desk could not tell me how to phone my friendÂ´s room from my room. No wake up service available.

review.title: good location, friendly staff
review.reviewText: we took the bus from sevilla to ronda. it was generally close to the bus and train station, within walking distance. there is no need for a car or public transportation while in town, everything is in walking distance. it was really close to the bridge and restaurants, one street away from the main street. the staff spoke english, very friendly and helpful. the room was a good size and quiet. the bathroom was really big. downsides. there was hair in the bed when we checked in and no internet connection. the bridge is worth the trip, it is truly amazing and we would go back in a second.

review.title: Could do better
review.reviewText: Ronda is a really good location.

review.title: Superb budget accomodation
review.reviewText: Excellent location, perfect service. Would recommend to anyone looking for a cheap, no-frills place to stay!

review.title: great surprise!
review.reviewText:
after staying in a not so nicely cared for hostal in another town, i felt
like i was in heaven arriving at this hotel. it was clean, pretty and comfy.
i stayed several nights cause it was so nice. and such a good price.

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText: Good location, good room, clean and nice hotel. Breakfast offered in the morning at extra charge.
